block.p: A picture caption in the Square Feet section of Business Day on Wednesday with an article on renovations at the Woolworth Building in Lower Manhattan misidentified one of the two people shown. The man at the left is Roy A. Suskin, vice president of development at the Witkoff Group, which is renovating the building -- not Richard Woodward, an associate at the architecture firm Gerner Kronick & Valcarcel.

A picture caption in the Square Feet section of Business Day on Wednesday with an article on renovations at the Woolworth Building in Lower Manhattan misidentified one of the two people shown. The man at the left is Roy A. Suskin, vice president of development at the Witkoff Group, which is renovating the building -- not Richard Woodward, an associate at the architecture firm Gerner Kronick & Valcarcel.
